raw_text:
Blunkett hints at election call
 
 Ex-Home Secretary David Blunkett has given fresh clues that the general election will be announced on Monday.
 
 He told BBC Radio Five Live: "I'm out in my constituency getting ready for what we presume will be an announcement very shortly at the weekend." He clarified that he meant he would be in his Sheffield seat this weekend, not that he expected an election call then. Tony Blair is tipped to ask the Queen on Monday to dissolve Parliament ready for a 5 May poll.
llama3.2:1b: David Blunkett has hinted at a general election announcement by saying he will be outside his constituency on Monday preparing for it, and that the Queen may request dissolution of Parliament on the same day.
llama3.2:3b: Ex-Home Secretary David Blunkett hinted that the general election will be announced soon, with Prime Minister Tony Blair likely to ask the Queen to dissolve Parliament by next Monday for a 5 May poll.
gemma2:2b: David Blunkett suggests the general election will be announced soon. He expects an announcement sometime this weekend. Tony Blair is expected to ask the Queen to dissolve Parliament and hold the election on May 5th.
qwen2.5:0.5b: David Blunkett hints at potential early elections; he is staying in his constituency; he clarified it means for Saturday's general election announcement; Blair is likely to ask the Queen for permission to dissolve parliament before May polls.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Ex-Home Secretary David Blunkett hints general election will likely occur shortly after Parliament's dissolution on Monday.
qwen2.5:3b: Ex-Home Secretary David Blunkett hinted that the general election will be announced soon, likely on Monday. He was in his Sheffield seat this weekend preparing for what he presumed would be an announcement shortly at the weekend, not expecting one then. It is also suggested that Tony Blair will ask the Queen to dissolve Parliament for a 5 May poll.
opencoder:1.5b:
"David Blunkett announced on Monday morning that he will be in Sheffield when the general election is called." 
"The BBC Radio Five Live said it was out there, and it is now out there, they are saying so as we wait for an announcement to make a decision."
As for Tony Blair's question about dissolving Parliament, it's been agreed with the Queen on Monday morning.

deepseek-r1:1.5b:
<think>
Okay, so I have this query where the user wants me to summarize a given text into a concise summary. Let me read through it carefully.

The first sentence mentions David Blunkett giving clues about an election call. That's a key point. He tells BBC Radio Five Live that he'll be in his Sheffield seat and not an election call next weekend. 

Then, there's Tony Blair who's being tipped to ask the Queen to dissolve Parliament on Monday for a 5 May poll. Wait, is that accurate? Because Tony Blair was involved in the Conservative Party's political reforms, but I'm not sure if he was expected to ask the Queen for the Parliament resolution. Maybe it's a bit off, but I'll go with what's stated.

I need to make sure I capture all these points without adding any explanations or formatting. The user wants only the summary in plain text, so no markdown or anything else. Got it.
</think>

David Blunkett has given clues that the general election will be announced on Monday, and he claims he will be in his Sheffield seat this weekend, not an election call next week. Tony Blair is tipped to ask the Queen on Monday to dissolve Parliament for a 5 May poll.
tinyllama:1.1b: Sources reveal that British Prime Minister Tony Blair has indicated that he may seek an early election in favor of his party's success in the upcoming elections. Ex-Home Secretary David Blunkett, who is currently out campaigning, has provided speculative clues about the impending announcement on the day following Tuesday, May 8th. While confirmation about the expected date and time may be premature, Mr. Blunkett has hinted that he plans to get ready for a possible announcement at the weekend in his constituency of Sheffield. No specifics have been given yet, however it is known that the announcement will likely come from Prime Minister Tony Blair, who is predicted to dissolve Parliament on Monday for the scheduled general elections.
tinydolphin:1.1b: A summary of the provided text: Ex-Home Secretary David Blunkett hinted at an announcement of a general election being made during his constituency visit. He specifically mentioned that he would be present in Sheffield, his seat, on the weekend to keep his fingers crossed for a potential announcement on Monday, which would coincide with Tony Blair's expected call to dissolve Parliament on a 5 May poll.
phi:2.7b: David Blunkett hints at a general election being announced on Monday by Prime Minister Tony Blair and expects the announcement to take place on the weekend in his constituency of Sheffield.
orca-mini:3b: ex-Home Secretary David Blunkett hinted at the general election announcement on Monday by stating that he would be in his Sheffield constituency this weekend, adding that he expected an election call then. It is suggested that former Prime Minister Tony Blair would ask Queen Elizabeth II to dissolve Parliament for a 5 May poll.
hermes3:3b: David Blunkett suggests general election may be announced mon, preparing for potential call.
stablelm-zephyr:3b: Ex-Home Secretary David Blunkett suggested that the general election will be announced on Monday. He revealed his plans to be in his Sheffield seat during the weekend, but clarified it was not meant to imply an election call then. It is believed that Tony Blair will ask the Queen to dissolve Parliament and hold the poll on May 5th.
chatgpt-4o-latest: David Blunkett suggested that a general election announcement is imminent, likely on Monday. He mentioned preparing in his constituency and clarified he would be in Sheffield over the weekend. Tony Blair is expected to ask the Queen to dissolve Parliament for a 5 May election.
stablelm2:1.6b: Former Home Secretary David Blunkett hints at general election announcement on Monday; however, clarified it won't happen then. Tony Blair likely asks Queen to dissolve Parliament for May 5th poll.
granite3.1-dense:2b: Ex-Home Secretary David Blunkett hinted at an upcoming general election during his BBC Radio Five Live interview, stating he would be in his Sheffield constituency this weekend. However, he emphasized that the announcement was anticipated for the following weekend, indicating a possible Monday dissolution of Parliament by Tony Blair, paving the way for a 5 May election.
reference: He clarified that he meant he would be in his Sheffield seat this weekend, not that he expected an election call then.Ex-Home Secretary David Blunkett has given fresh clues that the general election will be announced on Monday.
